document_data.caption: ''An elder brain dragon spewing forth brine.''
document_data.name: Elder Brain Dragon
document_data.mainbody: An '''elder brain dragon''' was an [[aberration]] that was formed when an [[illithid]] [[elder brain]] took over the body of a living [[dragon]].
document_data.Description: Elder brain dragons did not require sleep or food for sustenance. Their bodies were imbued with [[psionic]] power.
document_data.Abilities: One significant advantage elder brain dragons held over other elder brains was their mobility. They were not constrained by the physiological limitations of having to remain within a brine pool, protected by their [[mind flayer]] servants and thralls.

Combat.Breath Weapon: Elder brain dragons possessed a unique and horrifying breath weapon. Just as other dragons could breath bursts of flame or jets of acid, elder brain dragons exhaled streams of brine filled with [[Mind flayer#Reproduction|illithid tadpoles]] that easily transformed victims into new mind flayers in short time.{{Cite adventurers league/Fall the Cold Night|23}}

document_data.Society:
Due to their mobility, elder brain dragons often served as generals to mind flayer armies.

If an elder brain dragon was slain, it was possible to set free the [[spirit]] of the dragon whose body was taken over. These spirits were capable of brief empathetic connection before departing for the [[afterlife]].{{Cite adventurers league/Fall the Cold Night|23}}
document_data.Notable Elder Brain Dragons: * [[Uresgol]], the elder brain that took over the body of the [[amethyst dragon]] [[Amaranthraxine]].{{Cite adventurers league/Fall the Cold Night|18}}
